title: One Secret to a Longer Life: Donâ€™t Become CEO in an Embattled Industry
sub_head: A study finds that chief executives who face unusual stress have reduced life expectancies (and appear to look older, as well)
body:
For many CEOs, stress is a routine part of their job. But what happens when they face extraordinary pressures like damaging economic shocks or the possibility of a hostile takeover?
New research suggests they are likely to pay a heavy price for enduring those stresses: reduced life expectancy.
